The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: I played the game\, I didn’t like the game\, it didn’t even feel like the same franchise as the first one. The first game shouldn’t have gotten a sequel in the first place but here we are. The whole game Ellie plows through hundreds to kill Abby but yet when she actually reaches Abby she doesn’t kill her? Why? To maintain her humanity? But she’s been killed so many people how could she save her humanity by sparing one person\, who has also killed tons of people. Abby is poorly written character\, I don’t hate her because she killed Joel or because shes buff\, she’s boring at best. She’s a violent and sarcastic soldier who has a dark past ooh so original and true whole revenge is bad plot point was so dumb. OH did you know being selfish and killing purely out of self interest is bad??? EVERYONE KNOWS THAT. The game is so heavy handed and annoying it acts like it’s telling a story that’s better than it actually is. But I’m gonna be real\, I didn’t completely hate the game\, I like the graphics\, the actors\, and the music. The part exploring the downtown area to get gas was probably my favorite part of the game just because it was beautiful\, has interesting dialogue every now and then\, and had the Take on Me scene. Okay game but that’s all I can say for it. Not a masterpiece by a long shot. If you want to play a game with great graphics\, actors\, characters\, and writing with a morally gray character then play red dead redemption 2\, not The Last of Us 2… Expand
